channel.title: RSBot now owned by a british company?
channel.description:
This seems highly irrational as Jagex would take legal action against them quite fast wouldn't they? Here: [img]http://i.imgur.com/ImPnr.png[/img]
[code]Company Number: 07584150 Established: 1 year ago March 30, 2011 Registered Address The Bristol Office 2 Southfield Road Bristol Avon BS9 3BH[/code] Anyway, I'd watch it while using RSBot, may be some BotNuke scheme.

item.source: RSBot now owned by a british company?

item.title: RSBot now owned by a british company?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:18, topic:439536”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=542228.msg3973310#msg3973310 date=1334371543]

well according to powerbot’s lawyers powerbot is perfectly legal b/c jagex has no proof on how powerbot operates and if they decompile powerbot that gives powerbot the ability to counter-sue.

This pisses me off. Punks are ruining a game for profit. “Nah nah a booby you cant touch me”

Jagex ruined their own game for profit.
[/quote]
Exactly. The gameplay matters the most, and considering java isn’t meant to make games Xbox games, they need to be simpler. I’m sure Java could easily be used, however the way they’re doing it is clearly wrong. Not many people were transferring to other games like they thought, and even if they did, they would still play RS, so I have no idea where they were getting that from.[/quote]

Wait Java isn’t meant for making games? Xbox games?

Read full topic
item.source: RSBot now owned by a british company?

item.title: RSBot now owned by a british company?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:11, topic:439536”][quote author=xryz link=topic=542228.msg3973316#msg3973316 date=1334371964]

well according to powerbot’s lawyers powerbot is perfectly legal b/c jagex has no proof on how powerbot operates and if they decompile powerbot that gives powerbot the ability to counter-sue.

Isn’t powerbot open-source?

no sadly it is now closed source to make it legal. they also assure that there isnt any malicious code in it b/c if there was they would get jail time. someone cloned rsbot b4 or after the nuke idk when but there is a github with all the source code from the old rsbot. the link is somewhere but idk if i have it.
[/quote]

Fyi, reverse engineering isn’t what’s illegal about what they are doing. Jagex can reverse engineer their bot all they want, who cares. It’s not like it’s their intellectual property, at any rate. All they are doing is using portions of Jagex’s code, which can actually be proved by reverse engineering it. And, at the end of the day, powerbot is profiting on Jagex’s intellectual property, in and of itself is more of a crime than any of the programmers committed.[/quote]Smartest comment from you so far in 2012 <3

Read full topic
item.source: RSBot now owned by a british company?

item.title: RSBot now owned by a british company?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:9, topic:439536”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=542228.msg3973228#msg3973228 date=1334363286]

well according to powerbot’s lawyers powerbot is perfectly legal b/c jagex has no proof on how powerbot operates and if they decompile powerbot that gives powerbot the ability to counter-sue.

This pisses me off. Punks are ruining a game for profit. “Nah nah a booby you cant touch me”
[/quote]

Jagex ruined their own game for profit.[/quote]
Exactly. The gameplay matters the most, and considering java isn’t meant to make games Xbox games, they need to be simpler. I’m sure Java could easily be used, however the way they’re doing it is clearly wrong. Not many people were transferring to other games like they thought, and even if they did, they would still play RS, so I have no idea where they were getting that from.

Read full topic
item.source: RSBot now owned by a british company?

item.title: RSBot now owned by a british company?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:9, topic:439536”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=542228.msg3973228#msg3973228 date=1334363286]

well according to powerbot’s lawyers powerbot is perfectly legal b/c jagex has no proof on how powerbot operates and if they decompile powerbot that gives powerbot the ability to counter-sue.

This pisses me off. Punks are ruining a game for profit. “Nah nah a booby you cant touch me”
[/quote]

Jagex ruined their own game for profit.[/quote]

They felt they needed to compete with World of Warcraft. When NOBODY was leaving to play world of warcraft.

Read full topic
item.source: RSBot now owned by a british company?

item.title: RSBot now owned by a british company?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:10, topic:439536”][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=542228.msg3973290#msg3973290 date=1334369403]

well according to powerbot’s lawyers powerbot is perfectly legal b/c jagex has no proof on how powerbot operates and if they decompile powerbot that gives powerbot the ability to counter-sue.

Isn’t powerbot open-source?
[/quote]
no sadly it is now closed source to make it legal. they also assure that there isnt any malicious code in it b/c if there was they would get jail time. someone cloned rsbot b4 or after the nuke idk when but there is a github with all the source code from the old rsbot. the link is somewhere but idk if i have it.[/quote]

Fyi, reverse engineering isn’t what’s illegal about what they are doing. Jagex can reverse engineer their bot all they want, who cares. It’s not like it’s their intellectual property, at any rate. All they are doing is using portions of Jagex’s code, which can actually be proved by reverse engineering it. And, at the end of the day, powerbot is profiting on Jagex’s intellectual property, in and of itself is more of a crime than any of the programmers committed.

Read full topic
